etymology.description: semantic 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") + phonetic 少(少) (shǎo, "little") = a little fire -> stir-fry
etymology.interpretation: The character 炒(chǎo) combines 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") to indicate cooking with heat, specifically stir-frying, with 少(少) (shǎo, "little") as a phonetic component. This suggests cooking with a small amount of heat or quickly.

examples.chinese: 他炒面时(他炒麵時)，加了很多蔬菜(加了很多蔬菜)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chǎo miàn shí, jiā le hěn duō shūcài.
examples.english: While he was stir-frying noodles, he added a lot of vegetables.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢炒牛肉(我喜歡炒牛肉)。
